title: References (Part 15)
content:
References

References (Part 15)

Continued References [199-209]

  • [199] Bhargavi Paranjape et al. - Art: Automatic multi-step reasoning and tool-use for large language models (2023)
  • [200] Zhipeng Chen et al. - ChatCoT: Tool-augmented chain-of-thought reasoning on chat-based large language models (2023)
  • [201] Yining Lu et al. - GEAR: Augmenting language models with generalizable and efficient tool resolution (2024)
  • [202] Shirley Wu et al. - Avatar: Optimizing llm agents for tool usage via contrastive reasoning (2024)
  • [203] Yujia Qin et al. - ToolLLM: Facilitating large language models to master 16000+ real-world APIs (2024)
  • [204] Qiaoyu Tang et al. - ToolAlpaca: Generalized tool learning for language models with 3000 simulated cases (2023)
  • [205] Mingyang Chen et al. - Learning to reason with search via reinforcement learning (2025)
  • [206] Qinqiu Dong et al. - Autotool: Dynamic tool selection and integration for agentic reasoning (2025)
  • [207] Yaobo Liang et al. - Taskmatrix.ai: Completing tasks by connecting foundation models with millions of APIs (2023)
  • [208] Pan Lu et al. - Octotools: An agentic framework with extensible tools for complex reasoning (2025)
  • [209] Pan Lu et al. - Octotools: An agentic framework with extensible tools for complex reasoning (2025)

Analysis & Explanation

Tool Learning and Integration

Key Systems
  • ToolLLM: Massive API integration
  • TaskMatrix: Foundation model tool connection
  • Octotools: Extensible tool frameworks
